text: A general view of Gerritsen Beach, looking northwest from a point northwest of Gerritsen and Emmons Aves., showing the swamp lands which were reclaimed and named Gerritsen Beach. About 1923.
title: General view - Brooklyn - Gerritsen Beach.

text:
Marine Park, west side of Gerritsen Creek, viewed eastward, showing Flatbush Ave. in the background. This is a set of 3 views taken from different angles.

June 23, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west side - Gerritsen Creek, east.

text:

title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west side - Gerritsen Creek, east.

text:

title: Brooklyn: Marine Park - west side - Gerritsen Creek, east.

text:
(1)
Plumb Island: A view of the remains of a wooden walk which led to shacks and boat landings on Plumb Beach Channel. This view is east towards Flatbush Ave., south of Gerritsen Beach.
June 18, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a different angle.
June 18, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Islands - Plumb Island - Brooklyn - [Plumb Beach Channel - Wooden walk.]
